items.content_html:
• Have you attended a Geek Squad Academy Event, and want to re-visit the classes?
  • Not able to attend a camp, but want to see what happens?

You’re in luck! You can access our instructor guides for all of our classes here: Academy Classes

Some of these classes are in the process of being updated, and as new versions are made they’ll be added. Old classes will stay around for reference in the ‘Archive.’

items.title: Geek Squad Academy at Home – 3D Design
items.summary: Hello Tech Hungry Civilian! In this class, we’ll be building a house in Sketchup! We’ll explore the Shape tools, Push/Pull, offsets, material choices, and if you’re feeling adventurous we’ll even make everything with real-world measurements in feet and inches. This project will take between 30…
items.content_html:
Hello Tech Hungry Civilian!

In this class, we’ll be building a house in Sketchup!  We’ll explore the Shape tools, Push/Pull, offsets, material choices, and if you’re feeling adventurous we’ll even make everything with real-world measurements in feet and inches. This project will take between 30 minutes and one hour depending on how detailed you choose to get, and will only require a computer with internet access, though a mouse is recommended!

SketchUp is an easy 3D modeling program for a wide range of drawing applications similar to those used in industries such as architecture, interior design, engineering, film, and video game design. Learning the basics of this program is a useful first step to understanding the process of creating and working on three-dimensional projects in a variety of possible future careers!

Like all Geek Squad Academy content, this activity was designed for students ages 10 to 18.

Requirements:

  • 1 computer with internet access
  • 1 computer mouse (recommended)

So, what are you waiting for? Let’s create something awesome!

Click the button below to download the free guide to this class!

Enjoy!

Having trouble with one of the tools? Find short videos for each tool below:

  • Rectangle and Shapes
  • Push/Pull
  • Line
  • Move
  • Eraser
  • Undo
  • Orbit
  • Offset
  • Materials
  • Adding Measurements
